name: .IWD File Extension
type_name: Call of Duty Game Data File
summary: Learn about .IWD files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An IWD file is a game data file used by various Activision games, namely Call of Duty 2 (CoD2) and Call of Duty 4 (CoD4). It may store various data, such as graphics, weapons, items, scripts, or other information referenced during gameplay. IWD files are included with the Call of Duty game installation and compressed with Zip compression to save disk space.

content: Call of Duty is a first-person shooter video game franchise where you play as soldiers in various battles ranging from World War 2 to modern warfare. Various Activision games use IWD files, but you will most likely encounter them in the CoD2 and CoD4 games from the 2000s. For example, you can find IWD files in the \​Program Files\​Activision\​Call of Duty\​main\​ directory of the games.

instructions: IWD files are not meant to be opened. Instead, Activision Call of Duty 2 and Call of Duty 4 reference the data in the files.

However, since IWD files are Zip-compressed, you can open them and extract their contents with a Zip utility, such as Microsoft File Explorer (Windows), Apple Archive Utility (macOS), or Corel WinZip (Windows). However, you should not modify IWD files unless you know the correct changes to make. Altering an IWD file may make it unusable by Call of Duty.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
